Cookie Policy

1. What are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to website owners.

Cookies can be "persistent" (remain on your device until deleted or expired) or "session" (deleted when you close your browser).

2. Types of Cookies We Use

2.1 Essential Cookies

These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly:

Session ID
Maintains user session state
Session
Language Preference
Remembers selected language
1 year
Cookie Consent
Stores cookie preferences
1 year

2.2 Performance Cookies

These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website:

Analytics
Collects anonymous usage statistics
2 years
Page Views
Tracks page popularity
30 days

2.3 Functionality Cookies

These cookies enhance your experience by remembering your preferences:

Theme Preference
Remembers dark/light mode choice
1 year
Form Data
Saves partially completed forms
7 days

3. Purpose of Cookie Use

3.1 Website Functionality

  • Enable core website features
  • Remember user preferences
  • Maintain session state
  • Provide personalized experience

3.2 Performance Analysis

  • Understand user behavior patterns
  • Identify popular content
  • Optimize website performance
  • Improve user experience

3.3 Security

  • Prevent fraudulent activity
  • Protect against spam
  • Secure user sessions
  • Detect suspicious behavior

4. Legal Basis

Our use of cookies is based on:

  • Consent: For non-essential cookies (performance, functionality)
  • Legitimate Interest: For essential cookies required for website operation
  • Legal Obligation: For cookies required by applicable laws

5. Managing Cookies

5.1 Cookie Preference Center

You can manage your cookie preferences through our cookie banner that appears on your first visit. You can:

  • Accept all cookies
  • Reject non-essential cookies
  • Customize preferences by category
  • Change preferences at any time

5.2 Browser Settings

You can also control cookies through your browser settings:

Chrome:

Settings → Privacy and Security → Cookies and other site data

Firefox:

Options → Privacy & Security → Cookies and Site Data

Safari:

Preferences → Privacy → Manage Website Data

Edge:

Settings → Cookies and site permissions → Cookies and site data

5.3 Third-Party Tools

You can use third-party tools to manage cookies:

  • Browser extensions for cookie management
  • Privacy-focused browsers
  • Ad blockers with cookie controls

6. Consequences of Disabling Cookies

6.1 Essential Cookies

Disabling essential cookies may result in:

  • Website functionality issues
  • Inability to maintain sessions
  • Loss of user preferences
  • Security vulnerabilities

6.2 Non-Essential Cookies

Disabling non-essential cookies may result in:

  • Less personalized experience
  • Repeated cookie consent requests
  • Limited analytics insights
  • Reduced website optimization

7. Third-Party Cookies

7.1 Analytics Services

We may use third-party analytics services that set their own cookies:

  • Google Analytics: Website usage analytics
  • Privacy Policy: Google Privacy Policy
  • Opt-out: Google Analytics Opt-out

7.2 Content Delivery

We use content delivery networks that may set cookies:

  • Font loading services
  • Image optimization services
  • Security services

8. Data Retention

Cookie data is retained for the following periods:

Session Cookies
Until browser is closed
Persistent Cookies
As specified in cookie settings (max 2 years)
Analytics Data
26 months maximum

9. Updates to This Policy

We may update this cookie policy periodically to reflect:

  • Changes in cookie usage
  • New legal requirements
  • Technology updates
  • Service improvements

Updates will be posted on this page with a revised effective date.

10. Contact Information

For questions about our cookie policy:

  • Email: privacy@sesecpro.com
  • Phone: +34 XXX XXX XXX
  • Address: Spain
